page.title: 01SEASIDE VILLAGE
page.content: Village; Electoral Register 700. Very dependant on tourist industry, incomes supplemented by renting out accommodation. Employment found on caravan/camping sites, hiring out boats, sailing equipment. No major industry sited here. Farms comparatively small and family run, not a great source of employment. Farming concentrates on beef and sheep, land not fertile enough for large scale crop-growing. During last 15 years half the houses built bought as holiday homes, as have older houses too. Social activity centres around church and chapels, youth movements, school and playgroup. Pubs and clubs provide meeting places for workers, also evening classes in Winter. Village Hall venue for coffee evenings, etc. Grocery Stores are corner shop types providing the
